snippet: President Obama was eager to highlight his administration’s efforts to revive the job market on the eve of another politically significant employment report.
abstract: Pres Obama, eager to promote his administration's efforts to revive the job market on the eve of another politically significant employment report, signs the JOBS Act, bill that will roll back restrictions on the way start-up companies can raise money from individual investors; rejects criticism that the measure will open the door to investor fraud.
lead_paragraph: President Obama was eager to highlight his administration’s efforts to revive the job market on the eve of another politically significant employment report.

headline.seo: Obama Signs Bill to Ease Investing in Start-Ups
headline.main: Obama Signs Bill to Promote Start-Up Investments
headline.print_headline: Obama Signs Bill to Promote Start-Up Investments
